title: Staff Engineer, Applied Machine Learning / Optimization, Payment Conversion
content:
Who we are
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team
Stripe Payments Conversion brings together product development with machine learning to increase Stripe’s authentication and authorization success rates at scale, while maintaining competitive transactional cost and minimizing fraud losses for our merchants. Getting this tradeoff right is critical to Stripe’s long term success and profitability. We maximize our merchant’s financial success while minimizing their losses and Stripe’s risk exposure.
The Payments Conversion team consists of backend, full stack and machine learning engineers who want to tackle this problem through creative new product ideas and impactful models. We are undertaking several new efforts, where you can have an outsized impact on the architecture, implementation, and design choices behind these systems. 
What you’ll do
You’ll be responsible for driving one of Stripe’s most critical objectives – Shaping how Stripe differentiates itself as the best option for maximizing payments conversion efficiently and at scale in a competitive payment service provider ecosystem. You’ll be leading efforts that span multiple teams including Payments, Risk and Fraud to achieve this objective. You’ll also work with external partners, including networks and issuers, and our largest merchants.
Responsibilities

This effort will include defining the strategy inclusive of modeling, predictive data, automation, and user experience that arms our merchant with actionable performance information.
Define strategy to enable Stripe and our user’s to understand, detect, and intervene to protect their businesses, and Stripe, from fraud losses while maximizing authentication and authorization success.
Design and deploy new models to iteratively improve Stripe’s business-critical models and systems that understand a user’s conversion performance.
Own and drive cross functional partnerships with organizations including GTM, Financial Partnerships, Product, etc., and partner closely with the leadership/stakeholders of various teams within those organizations 
As a leader within Engineering, assist with team growth and development while maintaining a high bar for excellence and technical curiosity.

Who you are
We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.
Minimum requirements

Demonstrated experience of leading company-wide initiatives spanning multiple teams and organizations OR leveraging deep domain expertise to influence tech roadmap planning and execution
Demonstrated ability to effectively collaborate across multiple teams and stakeholders to drive business outcomes 
Demonstrated ability to balance execution and velocity with security, reliability, and efficiency
Experience, mentoring, and investing in the development engineers and peers 

Preferred qualifications

15+ years of engineering experience OR equivalent combined work experience reflecting domain expertise as relevant to this position 
Experience with applied machine learning to practical problems
Experience with applied analytics and data-driven decision making
Experience with payments or fraud

compliance.description: <p>PUBLIC BURDEN STATEMENT: According to the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995 no persons are required to respond to a collection of information unless such collection displays a valid OMB control number. This survey should take about 5 minutes to complete.</p>

Yes, I have a disability, or have had one in the past
I identify as one or more of the classifications of a protected veteran
I am not a protected veteran
Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

questions.label: Please select the country where you currently reside.
Please select the country or countries you anticipate working in for the role in which you are applying.
Are you authorized to work in the location(s) you selected in your previous response?
Will you require Stripe to sponsor you for a work permit now or in the future for the location(s) you selected in in your previous response?

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
questions.label: If this role offers the option to work from a remote location, do you plan to work remotely?

values.label: Yes, I intend to work remotely.
No, I intend to work from an office location.

questions.description: Please only count full time, industry roles, not intern roles school work or side projects.
questions.label: How many years of experience full time, industry do you have as a software engineer? (not counting internships or school work)

values.label: None - I am a new grad.
0 - 1 years of experience as a software engineer
1 - 5 years of experience as a software engineer
6 - 10 years of experience as a software engineer
10+ years of experience as a software engineer

questions.description: This may include in applied machine learning to real world problems, or a large variety of broad adjacent areas such as ranking, search, personalization, targeting, optimization, fraud / scoring, etc.
questions.label: Do you have any experience with applied machine learning or data science?

values.label: None - I don't have any experience
A little - I have exposure to them or partnered with cross-functional partners who have ML or Data Science application experience
Some - A small to medium part of my work has included ML or Data Science applications
Expertise - The majority of my work has included ML or Data Science applications
